function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Perceived fairness of law enforcement in creating and enforcing COVID-19 mitigation measures","Impact":"Low procedural justice could lead to non-compliance with COVID-19 measures and increased spread of the virus.","Mitigation":"Training law enforcement officers on procedural justice and creating transparent and participatory processes for creating and enforcing measures.","Technologies":"Training programs, community engagement platforms, transparency tools","People":"General public, law enforcement officers, policymakers","Owner":"Government, law enforcement agencies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Reliance on self-reported compliance data","Impact":"Inaccurate reporting could lead to misrepresentation of actual compliance rates and effectiveness of measures.","Mitigation":"Implementing objective compliance measurement methods, such as observation and data analysis.","Technologies":"Surveillance technology, data analysis tools, compliance monitoring systems","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, government"},{"Description":"Publication of non-peer reviewed research","Impact":"Potential dissemination of unverified or flawed findings, leading to misguided public health actions.","Mitigation":"Subjecting research to peer review before wide dissemination, clearly labeling as non-peer reviewed.","Technologies":"Peer review platforms, research validation tools, publication labeling systems","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers, general public","Owner":"Research institutions, publication platforms, academic journals"}]}
